body.name: PandaEar 6 Pack Silicone Water Bottle Cap, Baby No Spill Bottles Top Spout Adapter for Toddlers Kids, BPA Free & Leak-Proof
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 20 hrs 14 mins
features: Safety and Durability: Crafted from food-grade silicone, our spout adapters are not only BPA-free but also dishwasher-safe, ensuring a safe and long-lasting solution for your child's hydration needs.
Mess-Free Design: The precision-fit plug creates a tight seal, eliminating leaks, while the no-spill valve controls liquid flow, reducing messy spills and splashes.
Versatile Compatibility: Designed to fit most beverage bottles in the market, our spout adapters protect your child's mouth from the rigidity of plastic bottle openings.
Portable Convenience: Lightweight and compact, the spout adapters are easy to carry, making them perfect for on-the-go activities.
Personalized and Vibrant: The package includes six lively colors, adding a playful touch. Effortlessly clean and customize with mild dish soap and water.
body.description: Upgrade your child's drinking experience with PandaEar's Silicone Water Bottle Caps – a blend of safety, convenience, and vibrant personalization for both parents and kids.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It slips right off! Its too big so it does not seal the water bottle so the water will just spill right on you little one 😠

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for water bottles
reviews.reviewText: I love these for when I’m on the go and littles need a drink of water. Even when they have their own, they want to drink from mine, but haven’t mastered it without pouring it all over themselves. These allow them to sip also without spilling. I only use these supervised with them because they are small, but baby and toddler can both drink from these without spilling. I stash a couple of these in the car for when I have forgotten their water bottles, but always have a regular bottle of water on hand. They wash well in the dishwasher and push right into the top of a water bottle easily, but tough enough they stay in place. You can’t sip a ton of water out with each sip, but a perfect amount for little ones. Overall, I like these and am happy to have them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for Older Kids or Adults
reviews.reviewText: This attaches tightly enough to be used by adults and older kids, but is a complete disaster for small kids. It's a good product if you set a reasonable expectation on what you're getting, i.e. don't put this on a water bottle and hand it to a three year old. After trying it with my toddler without much success these are used by my wife and I with much better results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars not leak proof, and don't fit snuggly enough
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. While these would work ok for adults and responsible older kids, I might trust a 4-5 year old with them, only if they're using them outdoors. But, they're marketed for toddlers! Absolutely not! They're also marketed as leak proof. But, they're not. If you turn them upside down or sideways, and shake them some, they can leak sometimes. They don't fit snuggly enough over the bottle opening. They are easily pulled off. If you put pressure on them, they can pop off. I was trying to show they leak when shaken, and the cap popped off, making a mess. Luckily, it was only water, and that I hadn't simply offered juice to my toddler grandchild. I can imagine that sticky, juice filled mess. 🙀😵‍💫 Since these don't seal fully, they probably won't maintain carbonated drinks. Though, if they did seal fully, you wouldn't be able to use them with carbonated drinks anyways. The build up of pressure would cause the tops to pop off. I knew they wouldn't be good with carbonated drinks. It isn't an issue, since these were intended for use by a toddler. I just wanted to mention it for others. I would have rated them at 4 stars. But, given the fact that they're marketed for toddlers, I rated them at 3 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Tried them on several different bottles and they slipped right off every single one. Very disappointing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Leaks and Tops Pop Off If Squeezed
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I love the idea of these water bottle toppers and this is the second set I have tried from different brands and both do the same thing. I tried several times for this review and you can see in my above video that they definitely leak and with just a small squeeze they expel water all over the place.If you have kiddos and teens that have a nervous habit and like to squeeze their water bottles (I am guilty of that too) these bottle caps will not work for them. I tried these on 20 Oz water bottles for reference.Every single one of them did the same thing they leaked or blew out the water if squeezed or dropped.Perhaps if just used very carefully these may work casual walks or to keep in your cup holder in your vehicle but for my bunch these don’t work. I do love the colors and I do admire the design of these but my search for finding bottle caps that stay on and don’t leak is still ongoing! I feel badly that these didn’t work for me. The colors are pretty, non-toxic food grade silicone six bottle tops for a great price! They’re just unfortunately not leak or spill proof.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars They leak & are loose
reviews.reviewText: They leak & are loose. They don't fit all bottles

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great to make a screw bottle top simple and easy
reviews.reviewText: So I am not going to lie I got these for me, an adult.. no toddler or kids because a lot of the cheaper water bottles I can buy are screw tops and if I'm in a rush it annoys me to unscrew to drink these fix that SO WELL... as long as your drink has no carbonation in it or is sparkling as that will put pressure on the top and it WILL slip off if the bottle falls, turned upside down or is shaken in anyway but that's not a fault of the product at it was made for basic drinks like juice and water and possibly milk.It WILL NOT fit anything larger than a basic/standard bottle mouth like those on soda bottles, basic water bottles (think those are 16oz i'm thinking of). I don't notice any leaks when I tested them with the cap on but did notice after some use if the cap is off it will leak but didn't try no cap before drinking so it might work but I assumed no leaks if sealed. Just pop the cap off stick in mouth and drink, you do not have to bite it to get liquid but it makes it a lot easier.
